If a woman isn't allowed access to the morning after pill, isn't allowed to have an abortion, and is forced to have a child, that will completely change her life.
 
 If a woman takes the morning after pill, later she may decide to have a family.
 
 What is the difference between an 8-hour fertilized egg and a child that has yet to be conceived?

post_info.post_title: Why is a fertilized egg so different than a child yet to be conceived?

One thing that I find is that people join these forums and start threads that really have been discussed many times already. Now I probably did the same thing when I started but it would be nice for someone to just search on these forums for the topic and perhaps from that create a new thread that addresses a more specific question. 
 
 So if you have a better question with this I'd be happy to answer but I find repeating myself over and over (and I'm not blaming you for that) to be tiresome.

If a woman isn't allowed access to the morning after pill, isn't allowed to have an abortion, and is forced to have a child, that will completely change her life.
 
 If a woman takes the morning after pill, later she may decide to have a family.

 
 And if she doesn't she could've just made a terrible mistake. If she takes it and decides to have a family, she can try again. Unfortunately, if the conservatives get their way, this won't be an option if you turn it around.
 
 
 
 
What is the difference between an 8-hour fertilized egg and a child that has yet to be conceived?

 
 Whats the difference between cooking a scrambled egg and burning a chicken alive?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Why is a fertilized egg so different than a child yet to be conceived?
